title: Idina Menzel is 'in talks' to play the evil stepmother Evelyn in a live-action musical
text:
She already won an Oscar for her song Let It Go from Frozen and now it looks as if Idina Menzel is hoping for another gold statuette.

The 48-year-old actress is said to be in talks to play Evelyn, the evil stepmother, in the live-action musical Cinderella.

Starring Camila Cabello, 22, as Cinders, it's written and directed by Kay Cannon and is based on an original idea by James Corden.

Another prime role: Idina Menzel, seen at the Toronto International Film Festival last month, is set to play Evelyn, the evil stepmother, in the musical movie Cinderella; seen in September

In an interesting twist, the news comes after Emmy winner Billy Porter, 50, was revealed to be circling the role of the fairy godmother - or should that be fairy godfather.

Cinderella, which is set to shoot in London next February, still has to cast the handsome Prince.

Idina is well qualified for her new role with a slew of award-winning musicals under her belt.

She was the first to play Maureen Johnson on stage in Rent for which she received a 1996 Tony nomination, and she was first to play Elphaba in Wicked, which earned her a Tony award in 2004.

An older version: How Disney depicted the evil stepmother in Cinderella in 1950

Her turn as Elizabeth Vaughan in the 2014 Broadway musical If/Then landed her a third Tony nomination.

Idina also lends her voice to Princess Elsa in Disney’s Frozen franchise. The sequel to the $1.2 billion-grossing hit comes out on November 22.

She sang the Oscar and Grammy winning song Let It Go from the animated fairy tale and won a Grammy for the movie's soundtrack.

The 48-year-old actress also voiced Princess Elsa in Disney’s Frozen franchise, winning an Oscar and a Grammy for Let It Go

Meanwhile, she is plenty busy in her career.

Aside from Frozen 2, Idina will next be seen on the bigscreen in Safdie brothers crime drama Uncut Gems, with Adam Sandler, due out on December 25.

Cinderella is set to bow on February 5, 2021.
